title: Ticket #386: BIND_ALL_INTERFACES always trumps NETWORK_INTERFACE
description:
BIND_ALL_INTERFACES defaults to True, even if NETWORK_INTERFACE is set, which is strange behavior. I think that the correct behavior should be that if NETWORK_INTERFACE is set in the configuration file / environment, BIND_ALL_INTERFACES should default to False, unless explicitly set.

Even better, I think that BIND_ALL_INTERFACES should be deprecated, and the following behavior should replace it:

NETWORK_INTERFACE would default to '*', which is equivalent to to 'BIND_ALL_INTERFACES = True'. Otherwise, if NETWORK_INTERFACE is set to an IP address or interface name (i.e. "eth0") would be equivalent to " 'BIND_ALL_INTERFACES = False' and 'NETWORK_INTERFACE = <name|addr>' as specified.
remarks:
2010-Dec-07 10:37:06 by danb:
Ben Cotton and Preston Smith at Purdue have requested that there be a way to specify which IP address to use as something like 128.210.*, because in some cases, it is awkward to have to specify an exact IP address.
